comment.body:
Yeah, I think right now it runs sequentially and don't make real usage of `p-queue`. We shouldn't await `queue.add` but `queue.onIdle()` at the end.

However, with that we must ensure errors are caught correctly: https://github.com/sindresorhus/p-queue#addfn-options

pull_request.title: Add support for `EXTENSIONS_LOCATION` setting
pull_request.body:
## Scope

Allows you to chose the storage location from which extensions are loaded. The API does this by copying over the extensions to a local folder (`./.directus` by default, configurable through `$TEMP_PATH`) on extensions load, and running the extensions from that folder. This syncing is required to allow us to load in the extensions as regular node modules like before.

What's changed:

- Added an `EXTENSIONS_LOCATION` env var
- If set, the API will copy over the extensions from the `EXTENSIONS_PATH` in the storage location to a local tmp folder 
- Added the `TEMP_PATH` env var to configure the path of the local tmp folder

## Potential Risks / Drawbacks

- It syncs to a local folder before startup, and then uses the local folder as if it was just a regular extensions folder. This should in theory mean that nothing really changed in how extensions operate outside of downloading the extensions during startup.
- If your extensions folder has tons of files, for example when you put `src` and `node_modules` in the extension folder, this will slow down the startup process quite a bit

## Review Notes / Questions

- I thought about checking out the extensions manifest to find what files we need to download to run the extension, but realized that API extensions can technically have their own dependency chain, making that a risky endeavor

---

Fixes #19803

pull_request.body:
## Scope

Allows you to chose the storage location from which extensions are loaded. The API does this by copying over the extensions to a local folder (`./.directus` by default, configurable through `$TEMP_PATH`) on extensions load, and running the extensions from that folder. This syncing is required to allow us to load in the extensions as regular node modules like before.

What's changed:

- Added an `EXTENSIONS_LOCATION` env var
- If set, the API will copy over the extensions from the `EXTENSIONS_PATH` in the storage location to a local tmp folder 
- Added the `TEMP_PATH` env var to configure the path of the local tmp folder

## Potential Risks / Drawbacks

- It syncs to a local folder before startup, and then uses the local folder as if it was just a regular extensions folder. This should in theory mean that nothing really changed in how extensions operate outside of downloading the extensions during startup.
- If your extensions folder has tons of files, for example when you put `src` and `node_modules` in the extension folder, this will slow down the startup process quite a bit

## Review Notes / Questions

- I thought about checking out the extensions manifest to find what files we need to download to run the extension, but realized that API extensions can technically have their own dependency chain, making that a risky endeavor

---

Fixes #19803

issue.title: FilterHandler type incomplete
issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

![Screenshot 2023-10-27 at 12 22 24](https://github.com/directus/directus/assets/6641242/88174f68-e8c2-48ee-b699-0d618317a6b4)


### To Reproduce

Create a function of type `FilterHandler<with a type>` try and pass that function to the hook filter function as the callback.

You should now see typescript throwing issue about how `FilterHandler<with a type>` is not the same as `FilterHandler`

### Directus Version

10.7.0

### Hosting Strategy

Self-Hosted (Custom)

issue.title: Error to return custom validation when creating subitems into Directus App
issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

Custom field validations are not performed when creating items using Direcuts App subscreens.

### To Reproduce

Create two custom models: Model A and Model B.

Model A must receive, among other fields, a selection field with permission to create a new Model B item.

Model B, in turn, has fields with customized validations, for example, a regex to validate email and another for phone numbers. Test the creation of Model B, including cases where the reported data must be blocked by validation.

Now, access the Model A item creation screen and within this screen, create a Model B item using information that should not go through custom validations.

You will notice that validations are ignored, and no feedback is displayed on the screen.

### Directus Version

v10.6.3

### Hosting Strategy

Directus Cloud

comment.body:
Thanks for the issue!
What type of relation do you use? On my end, it seems to work fine with all relation types expect for Many-to-Many.

issue.title: Copy to action in flows gives error
issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

Anytime I try and use the "copy to" action to copy a flow operation from one flow to another I get the error:

[RECORD_NOT_UNIQUE] Value for field "resolve" in collection "directus_operations" has to be unique.

### To Reproduce

Create 2 flows.
In one create a new operation (it doesn't seem to matter what it is).
Save the operation and the flow.
Edit the flow and select "copy to" on operation and attempt to copy it to the other flow.
Error appears.

I'm using docker-compose set up with Postgis 13.

### Directus Version

v10.7.0

### Hosting Strategy

Self-Hosted (Docker Image)

comment.body:
Important to note that this only happens with operations that are linked to a subsequent one.

I think we shouldn't copy the `resolve` field (and maybe others) along.

comment.body:
Thank you for the issue!
Our translations are managed via Crowdin [^1], which means everyone can contribute.
I fixed the translation now, but next time you are welcome to correct it yourself ❤️ 

[^1]: https://docs.directus.io/contributing/introduction.html#translate-the-app

pull_request.title: Optimize Directus startup
pull_request.body:
Optimize Directus startup by:


 - Grouping io operations in parallel
 - Running checks in provisional assumption fashion (ie. assume it most likely will succeed)
 - Execute heavy app bundling process in async

issue.title: Optimize Directus startup
issue.body:
Optimize Directus startup by:


 - Grouping io operations in parallel
 - Running checks in provisional assumption fashion (ie. assume it most likely will succeed)
 - Execute heavy app bundling process in async

comment.body: Heya! Thank you for your contribution. Unfortunately, we can't accept PRs for improvements/features that don't have a prior accepted Discussion and associated Issue (as per the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/directus/directus/blob/main/contributing.md#pull-requests)). This is to ensure that PRs that are opened will actually get the chance to be reviewed, merged, and maintained by the core maintainers. We can reopen and continue this PR review once the requirements have been met. Thank you for your understanding!

## Scope

What's changed:

- Adds the theming fields to the app required minimal permissions

## Potential Risks / Drawbacks

- None. There's no security implications around theming rules

## Review Notes / Questions

—

---

Fixes #20135

comment.body: What if we don't want to allow our users to change the theme? It would be dumb to have these fields visible but disabled.

issue.title: Permissions for "App Access Minimum" does not allow user to view app
issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

When you set the permissions using the `App Access Minimum` and try and login as the user, after login you are greeted with  an error "No App Access - the user isn't allowed to use the admin app."



### To Reproduce

1. Create a new role & user with new role.
2. Use the `App Access Minimum` link to reset system permissions.
3. Do not change any other permissions.
4. Try and login with new user.
5. Greeted with error message.

Workaround:
1. Changing the `directus_users` read value from `required for app access` to `all access` allows user to login and view the app.

### Directus Version

10.7.0

### Hosting Strategy

Self-Hosted (Docker Image)

comment.body: Shouldn't this have been hot-fixed release asap, no other users except admin can use Directus 10.7.0 currently?

issue.title: Error "Image source too large to preview" persists for smaller image files until the page is refreshed
issue.body: ### Preflight Checklist - [X] I have completed all [Troubleshooting Steps](https://docs.directus.io/getting-started/support/#troubleshooting-steps). - [X] I'm on [the latest version of Directus](https://github.com/directus/directus/releases). - [X] There's [no other issue](https://github.com/directus/directus/issues?q=is%3Aissue) that already describes my problem. ### Describe the Bug Directus displays an error: "Image source too large to preview" instead of a thumbnail (as shown in the first screenshot below) when using image files that have physical dimensions higher than 6000px in height or width. However, when the big image is replaced with a smaller one (dimensions below 6000px), the error persists (second screenshot) unless the page is refreshed (data model is saved). ### To Reproduce 1. Create a data model that has an image file attached. 2. Go to the content, create a new instance of that data model 3. Set their image to an image that is too big to preview (> 6000px wide/high) 4. Save the instance. 5. Go back to editing the instance, remove the image that's too big to preview and replace it with one that isn't too big to preview. This should still display the mentioned error until the instance is saved (the thumbnail is showed after save). ### Errors Shown _No response_ ### What version of Directus are you using? 9.7.1 ### What version of Node.js are you using? 16.14.2 ### What database are you using? Postgres 12.10 ### What browser are you using? Chrome ### What operating system are you using? macOS ### How are you deploying Directus? Heroku

issue.title: Uploading a file with size above FILES_MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE leaves a half uploaded file
issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

I set the FILES_MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE value to '10mb', when I try to upload a 20mb image, it uploads the image first (progress bar completes, it takes a while) and then gives me back an error saying the uploaded size is too much.

![Screenshot 2023-10-27 at 10 02 27](https://github.com/directus/directus/assets/4146384/f71eb4c1-63ea-4e0c-bce3-c61f1f439f6f)

It then leaves a file which did not succeed, but is in my library.

### To Reproduce

- Set the FILES_MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE='10mb'
- Go to your library and upload a file larger then that
- See how it leaves a failed upload behind, and see how it takes until the image is uploaded to throw the error

### Directus Version

v10.6.3

### Hosting Strategy

Self-Hosted (Docker Image)

issue.title: fix duplicate extensions clash
issue.body:
This will insert new rows, so exisiting ones without prefix could be removed.

Also benefit is that the type and structure of name looks same as those of bundled extensions.

Fixes #20213
